docs.title: Index Page
docs.text: This site contains the project documentation for the learning python project setup

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
The documentation follows the best practice for project documentation as described by Daniele Procida in the Diátaxis documentation framework and consists of four separate parts:

  1. Tutorials
  2. How-To Guides
  3. Reference
  4. Explanation

docs.title: example_app.service
docs.text:
Provides several sample functions.

The module contains the following functions:

  • foo(a, b) - Returns the sum of two numbers (int).
  • `bar(a)' - Returns a hello message with the input string.

docs.title: bar(name='Frank Herbert')
docs.text:
Says 'Hello' with input.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default name str

input string

'Frank Herbert'

Returns:

Type Description str

A 'Hello' message.

Source code in src/example_app/service.py 
def bar(name: str = "Frank Herbert") -> str:
"""
    Says 'Hello' with input.

    Args:
        name: input string

    Returns:
        A 'Hello' message.
    """
    return f"Hello, {name}!"

docs.title: foo(a, b)
docs.text:
This is a description what the function does.

Examples:

>>> foo(a=1, b=2)
3
>>> foo(a=4, b=15)
19

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default a int

This is the first summand

required b int

This is the second summand

required

Returns:

Type Description int

The summation of a and b.

Source code in src/example_app/service.py 
def foo(a: int, b: int) -> int:
"""
    This is a description what the function does.

    Examples:
        >>> foo(a=1, b=2)
        3
        >>> foo(a=4, b=15)
        19

    Args:
        a: This is the first summand
        b: This is the second summand

    Returns:
        The summation of a and b.
    """
    return a + b
